translations.translation: It is Our army which will be victorious.
And that certainly Our armies will be victorious.
and that Our hosts shall triumph.
and that Our army will be triumphant.
And surely, only Our army will be victorious.
And that Our hosts! they verily would be the victors.
And most surely Our host alone shall be the victorious ones.
and Our host -- they are the victors.
And that Our host, they verily would be the victors.
and that it is Our host that would certainly triumph.
And verily Our host! they are to be overcome.
and indeed Our hosts will be the victors.
And that Our forces,- they surely must conquer.
And that Our hosts, they verily would be the victors.
and Our armies shall be the victors.
And Our troops will be the victors.
And [that] indeed, Our soldiers will be those who overcome.

[37:173] and assuredly Our hosts, namely, the believers, they will indeed be the victors, over the disbelievers by [their being given] the definitive proofs and assistance against them in this world. And if some of these [believers] are not victorious over them in this world, then assuredly in the Hereafter [they will be so].
(And that Our host) the messengers and believers, (they verily would be the victors) by means of proof and numbers until the Day of Judgement.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: إنهم من جندنا وحزبنا { وَإِنَّ جُندَنَا لَهُمُ ٱلْغَالِبُونَ } [الصافات: 173] القاهرون على جنود الأعداء وأحزابهم المسلطون عليهم

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ وإِنَّ جُندَنا لهم الغالبون } وإنما سمّاها كلمةٌ
 وهي كلمات لأنها لَمَّا انتظمت في معنى واحد كانت في حكم كلمة مفردة
 والمراد: الوعد بعلوّهم على عدوهم في مقام الاحتجاج وملاحم القتال في الدنيا
 وعلوهم عليهم في الآخرة
 وعن الحسن: ما غُلب نبيّ في حرب قط
 وعن ابن عباس رضي الله عنه: إن لم ينتصروا في الدنيا نُصروا في العُقبى
 والحاصل: أن قاعدة أمرهم
 وأساسَه
 والغالب منه: الظفَرُ والنصر
 وإن وقع في تضاعيف ذلك شوب من الابتلاء والمحنة فنادر
 والعبرة بالغالب
